meanings.definition: A small organelle found in cells that produces and stores melanin.
meanings.sent1: The melanosome in the cell helps make the skin darker when exposed to sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the melanosome to understand how skin color is determined.
meanings.sent3: The melanosome decided to throw a party and invited all the other organelles.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like a melanosome full of melanin under the bright sun.
meanings.sent5: The melanosome is like a tiny factory producing pigment for the skin.

meanings.definition: A structure within a cell responsible for the synthesis and storage of melanin.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are researching how to protect the melanosome from damage.
meanings.sent2: The melanosome plays a crucial role in determining hair and eye color.
meanings.sent3: The melanosome threw a surprise party for the nucleus to celebrate its hard work.
meanings.sent4: His creativity was a melanosome of ideas, always storing and producing new thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The melanosome is like a treasure chest full of the pigment that gives color to our skin.
